Normal dialog.

```js
class DialogExample extends React.Component {
  constructor(props) {
    super(props);
    this.state = { open: false };
    this.onShow = this.onShow.bind(this);
    this.onClose = this.onClose.bind(this);
  }

  onShow() {
    this.setState({ open: true });
  }

  onClose() {
    this.setState({ open: false });
  }

  render() {
    return (
      <React.Fragment>
        <Button onClick={this.onShow}>Show dialog</Button>

        <Dialog open={this.state.open} onCancel={this.onClose}>
          <DialogHeader>Use Google's location service?</DialogHeader>
          <DialogBody>
            Let Google help apps determine location. This means sending
            anonymous location data to Google, even when no apps are running.
          </DialogBody>
          <DialogFooter>
            <DialogFooterButton onClick={this.onClose}>
              Cancel
            </DialogFooterButton>
            <DialogFooterButton onClick={this.onClose}>
              Accept
            </DialogFooterButton>
          </DialogFooter>
        </Dialog>
      </React.Fragment>
    );
  }
}

<DialogExample />;
```

Dialog with scrollable content.

```js
class DialogExample extends React.Component {
  constructor(props) {
    super(props);
    this.state = { open: false };
    this.onShow = this.onShow.bind(this);
    this.onClose = this.onClose.bind(this);
  }

  onShow() {
    this.setState({ open: true });
  }

  onClose() {
    this.setState({ open: false });
  }

  render() {
    return (
      <React.Fragment>
        <Button onClick={this.onShow}>Show dialog</Button>

        <Dialog open={this.state.open} onCancel={this.onClose}>
          <DialogHeader>Choose a Ringtone</DialogHeader>
          <DialogBody scrollable>
            <List>
              <ListItem>None</ListItem>
              <ListItem>Callisto</ListItem>
              <ListItem>Ganymede</ListItem>
              <ListItem>Luna</ListItem>
              <ListItem>Marimba</ListItem>
              <ListItem>Schwifty</ListItem>
              <ListItem>Callisto</ListItem>
              <ListItem>Ganymede</ListItem>
              <ListItem>Luna</ListItem>
              <ListItem>Marimba</ListItem>
              <ListItem>Schwifty</ListItem>
            </List>
          </DialogBody>
          <DialogFooter>
            <DialogFooterButton onClick={this.onClose}>
              Decline
            </DialogFooterButton>
            <DialogFooterButton onClick={this.onClose}>
              Accept
            </DialogFooterButton>
          </DialogFooter>
        </Dialog>
      </React.Fragment>
    );
  }
}

<DialogExample />;
```

Scrollable dialog that takes up the whole screen height.

```js
class DialogExample extends React.Component {
  constructor(props) {
    super(props);
    this.state = { open: false };
    this.onShow = this.onShow.bind(this);
    this.onClose = this.onClose.bind(this);
  }

  onShow() {
    this.setState({ open: true });
  }

  onClose() {
    this.setState({ open: false });
  }

  render() {
    const list = ["None", "Callisto", "Ganymede", "Luna", "Mariba", "Schiwfty"];
    let fullList = [];
    for (let i = 0; i < 10; i++) {
      fullList = fullList.concat(list);
    }
    return (
      <React.Fragment>
        <Button onClick={this.onShow}>Show dialog</Button>

        <Dialog open={this.state.open} onCancel={this.onClose}>
          <DialogHeader>Choose a Ringtone</DialogHeader>
          <DialogBody scrollable fullHeight>
            <List>
              {fullList.map((item, i) => <ListItem key={i}>{item}</ListItem>)}
            </List>
          </DialogBody>
          <DialogFooter>
            <DialogFooterButton onClick={this.onClose}>Ok</DialogFooterButton>
          </DialogFooter>
        </Dialog>
      </React.Fragment>
    );
  }
}

<DialogExample />;
```
